tags: was that even an answer or just me having another stroke over this ship? results are inconclusive
summary: some thoughts about that clip of arya kissing gendry next week: 1. they look like their heads are at a relatively similar...
question: some thoughts about that clip of arya kissing gendry next week: 1. they look like their heads are at a relatively similar height, so they might be sitting down together. 2. the brightness to the right could be a fire, like they're relaxing. 3. arya is holding his face but gendry seems to be moving forward into he kiss on his own
answer:
I’m loving all the analysis I’m seeing of this two second clip, you have no idea!

(gif via @thatonekimgirl)

1) I think you’re right that their height difference doesn’t seem as drastic here as when they were standing and kissing in Ep 2. It might just be the angle of the shot, but that combined with how close the rest of their bodies seem to be and how relaxed they look, makes me think Arya could…… be sitting………… in his lap (rip me).

2) The coloring here does seem to have less of an orange cast than the torchlight from Ep 2, but who know if it means anything. Maybe during the feast they dipped out to be alone or even just after the funeral ceremony. Not sure if they returned to “the room where it happened” or just found some other private spot. My completely tinfoil idea is that they could maybesortakinda be in a cabin on one of the ships we see setting sail for KL in the preview.

3) Either way, they definitely need a moment together to process everything that happened, their roles in it, and what that means for them going forward when they previously didn’t even think there would be a future to worry about. So finding a small, private spot to just be together and breathe? Necessary. And they definitely look like they found it. I mean look how goddamn tender they are here. She’s gently cupping his face in both of her tiny hands! Her eyes are just about to slip shut! He’s moving in so slowly like he’s savoring every second! And she’s right there ready for him! Just fuck me up!

summary: Something I absolutely need in 804 or 805: Arya and Brienne spar for a second time and Jon notices. Jon asks to spar next with...
body:
Something I absolutely need in 804 or 805: Arya and Brienne spar for a second time and Jon notices. Jon asks to spar next with Arya after being thoroughly impressed with her performance and Arya just absolutely wipes the floor with him. Jon’s expecting her to fight him like a normal swordsman so he’s not prepared for her water-dancing, her ambidexterity, her use of multiple weapons within seconds of each other, or her sneaky tricks and manipulations. Jon is just completely stunned by the end of their dual. But Jon is out of breath and smiling because it’s been years since he had fun fighting.

We deserve to have a fun light-hearted scene where two siblings bond and just have fun. And Jon hasn’t seen Arya fight yet so it would be amazing to see him reacting real-time to her skill and prowess.

title: Back in Braavos
body:
Arya: I've never been happier.
Jaqen: I'm worried.
Arya: Because I'm happy?
Jaqen: No. Because I am.
Arya: Jaqen, that's...
Jaqen: Ironic? Weird? Crazy?
Arya: I was going to say normal.

dialogue.name: Arya
dialogue.label: Arya:
dialogue.phrase: I was going to say normal.

summary: Game of Thrones Season 8, Episode 3:  The Long Night
title: Game of Thrones Season 8, Episode 3:  The Long Night
body:
Hi Princeharryandme. It would be better if I submit this regarding the Winter Is Coming ask earlier. Bear with me for the long post. Haha!

1. Like what the majority of the viewers have said about the darkness of the whole episode, I understand the concept of darkness as the whole battle was against the Night King, White Walkers, wights and the Undead Army.

However, they could have considered to adjust the darkness since TV viewers are not watching the episodes in “cinemas or theaters”. All have different sizes of their television plus the settings but it could have been appreciated if they did so post-production.

The Long Night is one of the stories people in the North have shared for generations. One can understand it deeply if you read the books for full details of the storylines because one will appreciate it all the more as compared to being a TV viewer only. The TV series has streamlined the storylines for brevity and practicality purposes.

Most people have observed that after Seasons 1-4, the writing of the show suffered a bit. It is due to the fact that there are no books anymore for the show creators and writers to follow as a guide for the storyline and dialogues.

Seasons 1-4 were flawless because the dialogues of the characters came out straight from the books. It’s funny, substantial, logical and amusing if you have read all of them.

Remember the moving scene between Robert Baratheon and Cersei Lannister in Season 1 where they had a conversation about Lyanna Stark and their marriage inside the room? I love that scene in Book 1 and the two actors (Mark Addy and Lena Headey) delivered it so well in the TV series.

Moreoever, notice the inconsistencies of the characters and plot in Seasons 5-7. Except for the penultimate episodes of each season (Episode 9 per season), I have no question for the battle scenes. I appreciate the hard work, quality and fight scenes that the characters and crew have done.

Season 5, Episode 9:  Battle at Hardhome

Season 6, Episode 9:  Battle of the Bastards

Season 7, Episode 6: Beyond the Wall

2. House Stark’s motto is Winter is Coming. Houses in the North know of the grave danger about the White Walkers generations ago. The Long Night of yore caused massive death because no one can ever survive the coldest winters for several years. Even Old Nan (old woman taking care of Bran after his accident) never failed to repeat the stories to the Stark children.

Here comes the story of Azor Ahai, a legendary figure who forged the sword called Lightbringer used to defeat the darkness of the Great Other. In the show, the “Great Other” is referred to as the Night King, White Walkers, wights and the undead army in general.

A prophecy predicts that Azor Ahai shall be reborn as The Prince that was Promised.

As you can see, the hype on the White Walkers since Season 1 mainly focused on this great threat of long winter nights, the undead and on whether the prophecy of Azor Ahai will come into fruition.

3. Fast forward to the final season where both book readers and tv viewers have been anticipating for the longest time ever only to be disappointed on the so-called Long Night. It takes ONE EPISODE to end the Night King vis-a-vis the hype since Season 1.

Just when you thought you couldn’t get annoyed a little further, the show creators must have thought that Episode 3 would blow everyone’s wits away only to find out that most have been dismayed by the ending.

Arya, jumping out of nowhere, stabbed the Night King at the exact spot where he was initially created. It was a dud and anticlimactic. I know there are divided opinions on the Arya arc but seriously?

I know there have easter eggs and signs on her since Season , Episode 1 started but why! A Song of Ice and Fire featuring Arya Stark?

Easter Eggs for Arya:

a. In Season 2, Melisandre told her: “I see darkness in you. Brown eyes, green eyes, blue eyes – eyes you’ll shut forever.”

b. In Season 5-6, her journey in Braavos at the House of Black and White, a temple devoted to the Many-Faced God to which The Faceless Men stay.

Arya met JaQen H'ghar in Season 2 where she was introduced to the Faceless Men’s ability to change appearance at will and their being mysterious assassins.

c. In Season 7, Bran gave Arya the valyrian steel dagger used to kill him in Season 2.

On a side note, I love that scene where Bran’s direwolf saved him. I love the direwolves and dragons in the books. It’s sad that direwolves don’t have enough screen time in the TV series for being expensive to make compared to the dragons.

d. In Season 8, Episode 1:

– The Hound told her how she used to not shut up before

– She sneaked up on Jon Snow aka Aegon Targaryen in godswood

e. In Season 8, Episode 2, she asked Gendry how and what the undead are like. Gendy described them as “Death”.

f. In Season 8, Episode 3, Melisandre reminded her again about the “eyes you’ll shut forever” bit coupled with the question: “And what do we say to the god of Death?”, to which she replied: “Not today”.

4.  Then we see her jumping out of nowhere. End of the Night. Nada.

As much as the easter eggs were there all along, I still believe that nowhere was her story arc focused on the undead since Season 1. As you have read from some comments, there was no connection between her and the Night King.

It feels like the audience was slightly robbed of the notion of the prophecy all along. Prophecy may or may not happen but why the overhype then? In the books, it is always being talked about that even in my dreams, I can still hear the words ringing in my ears. Damn you, GRRM. Your words have deep impact on the book readers. Haha! 

Add the “A Song of Ice and Fire” story on Jon being both a Stark and a Targaryen and/or Daenerys Targaryen. Both have suffered tremendously on their journeys since Season 1.

Jon went through countless battles in the North that started with the Wildlings, Thenn and the White Walkers. Daenerys, on the other hand, lost her Dothraki husband, followers and Viserion (sad), broke chains of the slaves, three full-grown dragons, the Unsullied, Second Sons and the Dothrakis.

Disappointment is real whether everyone agrees or not. We can go on and on about this but just why! Thank you. Haha!

————————————————

WOW!!! Thank you so much!! I really appreciate this! Tons!
I just watched the entire series this month for the first time so I wasn’t around to discuss episodes with others and this is what I needed.


I’m starting the series again so I can pick up all the stuff that I missed and will use this as a guide.
I seemed to have missed when the story of Azor Ahai was told. Was it Bran’s nanny that told it?

I’ve never heard the term easter eggs used before but I get it.


Now I understand long term viewers issue with the one episode fight. I did think Arya’s scene was the best part and the lighting was just flat out annoying .
Thank you so much. I may post questions to you in the future if ok. I will call you GOT anon. xx

Hi Princeharryandme. It would be better if I submit this regarding the Winter Is Coming ask earlier. Bear with me for the long post. Haha!

1. Like what the majority of the viewers have said about the darkness of the whole episode, I understand the concept of darkness as the whole battle was against the Night King, White Walkers, wights and the Undead Army.

However, they could have considered to adjust the darkness since TV viewers are not watching the episodes in “cinemas or theaters”. All have different sizes of their television plus the settings but it could have been appreciated if they did so post-production.

The Long Night is one of the stories people in the North have shared for generations. One can understand it deeply if you read the books for full details of the storylines because one will appreciate it all the more as compared to being a TV viewer only. The TV series has streamlined the storylines for brevity and practicality purposes.

Most people have observed that after Seasons 1-4, the writing of the show suffered a bit. It is due to the fact that there are no books anymore for the show creators and writers to follow as a guide for the storyline and dialogues.

Seasons 1-4 were flawless because the dialogues of the characters came out straight from the books. It’s funny, substantial, logical and amusing if you have read all of them.

Remember the moving scene between Robert Baratheon and Cersei Lannister in Season 1 where they had a conversation about Lyanna Stark and their marriage inside the room? I love that scene in Book 1 and the two actors (Mark Addy and Lena Headey) delivered it so well in the TV series.

Moreoever, notice the inconsistencies of the characters and plot in Seasons 5-7. Except for the penultimate episodes of each season (Episode 9 per season), I have no question for the battle scenes. I appreciate the hard work, quality and fight scenes that the characters and crew have done.

Season 5, Episode 9:  Battle at Hardhome

Season 6, Episode 9:  Battle of the Bastards

Season 7, Episode 6: Beyond the Wall

2. House Stark’s motto is Winter is Coming. Houses in the North know of the grave danger about the White Walkers generations ago. The Long Night of yore caused massive death because no one can ever survive the coldest winters for several years. Even Old Nan (old woman taking care of Bran after his accident) never failed to repeat the stories to the Stark children.

Here comes the story of Azor Ahai, a legendary figure who forged the sword called Lightbringer used to defeat the darkness of the Great Other. In the show, the “Great Other” is referred to as the Night King, White Walkers, wights and the undead army in general.

A prophecy predicts that Azor Ahai shall be reborn as The Prince that was Promised.

As you can see, the hype on the White Walkers since Season 1 mainly focused on this great threat of long winter nights, the undead and on whether the prophecy of Azor Ahai will come into fruition.

3. Fast forward to the final season where both book readers and tv viewers have been anticipating for the longest time ever only to be disappointed on the so-called Long Night. It takes ONE EPISODE to end the Night King vis-a-vis the hype since Season 1.

Just when you thought you couldn’t get annoyed a little further, the show creators must have thought that Episode 3 would blow everyone’s wits away only to find out that most have been dismayed by the ending.

Arya, jumping out of nowhere, stabbed the Night King at the exact spot where he was initially created. It was a dud and anticlimactic. I know there are divided opinions on the Arya arc but seriously?

I know there have easter eggs and signs on her since Season , Episode 1 started but why! A Song of Ice and Fire featuring Arya Stark?

Easter Eggs for Arya:

a. In Season 2, Melisandre told her: “I see darkness in you. Brown eyes, green eyes, blue eyes – eyes you’ll shut forever.”

b. In Season 5-6, her journey in Braavos at the House of Black and White, a temple devoted to the Many-Faced God to which The Faceless Men stay.

Arya met JaQen H'ghar in Season 2 where she was introduced to the Faceless Men’s ability to change appearance at will and their being mysterious assassins.

c. In Season 7, Bran gave Arya the valyrian steel dagger used to kill him in Season 2.

On a side note, I love that scene where Bran’s direwolf saved him. I love the direwolves and dragons in the books. It’s sad that direwolves don’t have enough screen time in the TV series for being expensive to make compared to the dragons.

d. In Season 8, Episode 1:

– The Hound told her how she used to not shut up before

– She sneaked up on Jon Snow aka Aegon Targaryen in godswood

e. In Season 8, Episode 2, she asked Gendry how and what the undead are like. Gendy described them as “Death”.

f. In Season 8, Episode 3, Melisandre reminded her again about the “eyes you’ll shut forever” bit coupled with the question: “And what do we say to the god of Death?”, to which she replied: “Not today”.

4.  Then we see her jumping out of nowhere. End of the Night. Nada.

As much as the easter eggs were there all along, I still believe that nowhere was her story arc focused on the undead since Season 1. As you have read from some comments, there was no connection between her and the Night King.

It feels like the audience was slightly robbed of the notion of the prophecy all along. Prophecy may or may not happen but why the overhype then? In the books, it is always being talked about that even in my dreams, I can still hear the words ringing in my ears. Damn you, GRRM. Your words have deep impact on the book readers. Haha! 

Add the “A Song of Ice and Fire” story on Jon being both a Stark and a Targaryen and/or Daenerys Targaryen. Both have suffered tremendously on their journeys since Season 1.

Jon went through countless battles in the North that started with the Wildlings, Thenn and the White Walkers. Daenerys, on the other hand, lost her Dothraki husband, followers and Viserion (sad), broke chains of the slaves, three full-grown dragons, the Unsullied, Second Sons and the Dothrakis.

Disappointment is real whether everyone agrees or not. We can go on and on about this but just why! Thank you. Haha!

————————————————

WOW!!! Thank you so much!! I really appreciate this! Tons!
I just watched the entire series this month for the first time so I wasn’t around to discuss episodes with others and this is what I needed.


I’m starting the series again so I can pick up all the stuff that I missed and will use this as a guide.
I seemed to have missed when the story of Azor Ahai was told. Was it Bran’s nanny that told it?

I’ve never heard the term easter eggs used before but I get it.


Now I understand long term viewers issue with the one episode fight. I did think Arya’s scene was the best part and the lighting was just flat out annoying .
Thank you so much. I may post questions to you in the future if ok. I will call you GOT anon. xx

blog.name: im-hardly-interesting
blog.title: I want to turn into flowers.

title: Everything is possible now
body:
Good evening my friends, today I want to make a mea culpa.
 I have always considered many of the theories that run on the internet about game of thrones very unlikely if not impossible, as I had already said about another of my posts I have nothing against the theory of DarkDany or like cabbage it is called, but I have always despised it because it went against a lot what had been done in the past seasons, true Daenarys can be aggressive and a little paranoid (which happens very often to people who continue the road of power), but not having never shown clear traits of madness, combined with the fact that in season 7 is willing to leave their desire for power for a greater good, I always thought that showrunners would never try to do something so important without first having created a solid base …… this until last week with the 8x03 I am now ready for everything and therefore I apologize for having so foolishly derided the various theories that they are or Dark! dany Meera as Jon’s sister (it exists) sansa pregnant with ramsey , syrio forell is a facesless men etc etc, I was a fool who had faith in 2 idiots … so now everything is possible not because I believe in theories no no is because I don’t believe in DnD intelligence.

Jon and Arya: Obsessed with...
body:

Jon and Arya: Obsessed with killing -Knight King and Westeros Queen-

blog.title: A Girl Is Arya Stark Of Winterfell

summary: A man does not fly like a bird, but one foot moves and then another and one day a man is there and a king dies.
text: A man does not fly like a bird, but one foot moves and then another and one day a man is there and a king dies.
source:
Jaqen “A Clash of Kings”

You guys……. HOLY. Is it just me or if it was in the show it would’ve been a HUGE foreshadow to Arya and the Night King?

reblog.comment:
Jaqen “A Clash of Kings”

summary: I’ve considered that the whole plot of “that’s where the heart is” would come back and maybe Arya would mercy kill The Hound...
body:
I’ve considered that the whole plot of “that’s where the heart is” would come back and maybe Arya would mercy kill The Hound (after he’s wounded killing The Mountain) but I think maybe the way she killed the NK was her using that lesson (although arguably he has no heart?).

Anyway, here’s why I DONT want The Hound the die killing The Mountain…

I feel like that would imply that Sandor’s PURPOSE was to destroy his brother and I HATE that idea. Life has been awful to Sandor. His brother turned him into this burned monster and that, plus his size, have made people scared of him and relegated him to a life of killing. In his soul, Sandor is a good man who is trying to do right in the world and trying to maybe even forgive himself and redeem himself for all the shit he did for the Lannister’s over the years. I really thought he was going to play a bigger role with his visions in the fire and maybe even having a higher purpose with the lord of light.
For him to go out murdering his brother, would make this all for not. He has been on a journey both physically and mentally. The Hound has finally found family in this motley crew of characters and I’d like to think he doesn’t WANT to kill The Mountain for revenge anymore.

I do think he will kill The Mountain but I really hope it’s not in a plot where he just goes down to KL and is like “I’m killing you, you cunt”. I think maybe The Mountain will be about to kill another character (Arya?) and The Hound will kill him in defense.

I want both Arya and The Hound to go on being bad asses together forever … but this is GOT and I probably won’t get what I want.

summary: “We’re here for a reason. The Lord of Light is keeping Beric alive for a reason. He gave a failed drunk priest the power to...
body:
“We’re here for a reason. The Lord of Light is keeping Beric alive for a reason. He gave a failed drunk priest the power to bring him back for a reason. We are part of something larger than ourselves.”

- Thoros of Myr

Melisandre was kept alive by the Lord of Light’s power because her purpose was to live long enough to enlighten the savior right when everything seemed hopeless and to help her realize her destiny.

Thoros was meant to meet Beric because Beric would need him to cling on to life until he would die for the right reason: saving the one girl who would save the world.

And that girl did save the world.

POETRY.

blog.name: nicoleknysak

summary: I’ll See You After Class (Gendrya Uni AU) Chapter 3
title: I’ll See You After Class (Gendrya Uni AU) Chapter 3
body:
Hi all check out my new chapter for my Gendrya Uni AU, here! 

Story Summary: Only child Arya, grows up in the foster system, goes to Uni and finds her childhood friend, Gendry is a professor at her Uni, and let’s just say they’ve both grown up a lot.
